items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty indicates a flat start; US, Asian markets gain
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: The S&P 500 sputtered to a record high close on Monday, rebounding from a brief setback after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said the U.S. central bank is in no hurry to implement further interest rate cuts. The Dow also posted an all-time closing high. The three major U.S. stock indexes registered gains for the quarter and for the month.

items.description: Jefferies issues a 'buy' call on PB Fintech with a target price of Rs 1,800, following a $100 million investment plan in a new healthcare venture, while maintaining an asset-light balance sheet.

items.description: Zen Technologies stock in focus after securing a Rs 46 crore Annual Maintenance Contract (AMC) from the Ministry of Defence, enhancing its role in military training and simulation.

items.title: Vodafone Idea stock plunges 33% in Sep, Rs 34,000 crore mcap wiped out
items.description: The stock closed at Rs10.36 per share on September 30, down from Rs15.64 at the start of the month, reducing its market cap to Rs72,000 crore from Rs1.06 lakh crore.

items.title: Tighter rules for gold financiers may hamper growth but brokerages feel Muthoot, Manappuram better placed
items.description: The Reserve Bank of India has directed gold financiers to review processes, identify lapses and take remedial measures within three months, which according to brokerages may weigh on their growth.

items.title: IREDA shares slip despite robust Q2 biz update; disbursements up 56%
items.description: The public sector undertaking disbursed 56 percent more loans in the quarter ending on September 30, compared to the same quarter last year.

items.title: Blue Dart stock surges 4% as firm to take on price hikes from January 1
items.description: Blue Dart's price hikes comes days after industry peer Allcargo Gati announced a 10.2 percent average general price increase starting from January 1, 2025.

items.title: M&M shares rise as September sales jump 24% led by SUVs
items.description: The SUV major sold 3,027 units, a positive increase of 25 percent after it sold 2,419 units in the same month of the previous year.

items.title: PC Jeweller stock hits upper circuit again as co plans stock split and Rs 646 crore fund raise from promoters
items.description: PC Jeweller Ltd has announced a 1:10 stock split and plans to raise Rs 646 crore through 11.5 crore convertible warrants priced at Rs 56.20 each. The stock surged 5 percent to Rs 187.07 on October 1.

items.title: Agri Picks Report October 01, 2024: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit, Rainfall across the country on Monday was 2.6 mm, 29% below the normal of 3.6 mm, according to the India Meteorological Department.

items.title: Live: Will Sensex, Nifty undergo a deeper correction? | Sebi rules out F&O changes | Opening Bell
items.description: Benchmark indices, Sensex and Nifty, extended their losses for a second consecutive day, recording the steepest decline since the August 5 market slump. The selloff was widespread, though the Nifty Realty index emerged as a rare exception, while sectors like Nifty Auto and Realty bore the brunt. Relief could be on the horizon on October 1, following SEBI's board meeting, which opted to keep changes in the F&O segment on hold. New developments included the introduction of MF Lite, expanded scope for the T+0 settlement cycle, the launch of a new asset class, among others. Looking ahead, market experts anticipate consolidation in upcoming sessions, as investors reallocate their portfolios ahead of Q2 results. Nifty is expected to face resistance at 26,000, with support around 25,500. This morning global cues are mixed. US indices ended at record highs, while Japan's Nikkei 225 rebounded 1% after seeing a sharp 4% fall yesterday, while Australian markets retreated from all-time highs. Meanwhile, escalating tensions in the Middle East cast a shadow on oil prices. Among stocks in focus, watch out for Tata Power, Mankind Pharma, NTPC, among others. Catch Lovisha Darad in conversation with Ruchit Jain, Lead Research Analyst at 5Paisa and Anirudh Garg, Partner and Head of Research at Invasset, PMS.

Its aluminium product segment is expected to outperform driven by advanced emission norms and wider adoption of EVs

items.title: Live: Sensex off 1,500 pts from record high, Nifty below 26,000 | Auto, Gold financiers in focus | Closing Bell
items.description:
Rangebound trade for D-Street. Sensex off over 1,500 pts from record highs. Nifty gives up nearly 500 pts from peaks. Bank Nifty off 1,500 pts from Mt 54K. Nifty IT top sectoral performer. Nifty Metal extends gain to 8th straight day. Nifty 50 gainers: Tech Mahindra, M&M, Britannia. Nifty 50 losers: IndusInd Bank, ONGC, Asian Paints. Nifty 500 leaders: KFin Tech, Saregama, BASF. Nifty 500 laggards: Welspun Corp, Westlife, Godawari Power. Catch Lovisha Darad and Ashish Bahety, Technical Analyst as they discuss stocks on their radar.
